meanings.definition: The act of projecting or the state of being projected.
meanings.sent1: Her projection of confidence inspired others to believe in themselves.
meanings.sent2: The projection of the movie on the big screen was flawless.
meanings.sent3: His projection of happiness made everyone around him smile.
meanings.sent4: The projection of light on the wall created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The projection of his voice filled the room with warmth.

meanings.definition: An estimate or forecast based on present trends or data.
meanings.sent1: The financial projection for the upcoming quarter looks promising.
meanings.sent2: The weather projection suggests a high chance of rain tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Her projection of the project's success was overly optimistic.
meanings.sent4: The projection of sales figures indicates a growth in revenue.
meanings.sent5: The projection of population growth is a key factor in urban planning.

meanings.definition: The presentation of an image on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The projection of the painting on the museum wall was stunning.
meanings.sent2: The holographic projection of the logo captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: His projection of the landscape on the screen was breathtaking.
meanings.sent4: The projection of stars on the ceiling created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The projection of colors on the canvas evoked strong emotions.

meanings.definition: The unconscious transfer of one's own desires or emotions onto another person.
meanings.sent1: Her projection of fear onto others caused unnecessary worry.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him understand his projection of anger onto his friend.
meanings.sent3: His projection of love onto his pet cat was endearing.
meanings.sent4: The projection of guilt onto his colleague strained their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The projection of insecurity onto his partner affected their communication.
